questions.text: Restriction fragment length polymorphism (RFLP) analysis can only be used to follow the inheritance of a genetic disease if

options.label: A
options.text: The disease-causing mutation is at or closely linked to an altered restriction site

options.label: B
options.text: Proteins of mutated and normal genes migrate differently upon gel electrophoresis

options.label: C
options.text: Mutations are outside of restriction sites so that cleaving still occurs

options.label: D
options.text: Restriction fragments remain the same size but their charge changes

questions.correct_answer: A. The disease-causing mutation is at or closely linked to an altered restriction site

questions.text: A child presents with severe growth failure, accelerated aging that causes adult complications such as diabetes and coronary artery disease,and microcephaly (small head) due to increased nerve cell death. In vitro assay of labeled thymidine incorporation reveals decreased levels of DNA synthesis compared to controls, but normal-sized labeled DNA fragments.The addition of protein extract from normal cells, gently heated to inactivate DNA polymerase, restores DNA synthesis in the child’s cell extracts to normal. Which of the enzymes used in DNA replication is likely to be defective in this child?

A culture of bacteria not resistant to tetracycline develops an infection from a virus that is derived from the lysis of tetracycline-resistant bacteria.Most of the bacterial progeny of the original culture is found to have become resistant to tetracycline. What phenomenon has occurred?
Guanosine triphosphate (GTP) is required by which of the following steps in protein synthesis?

options.label: A
options.text: Aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase activation of amino acids

options.label: B
options.text: Attachment of ribosomes to endoplasmic reticulum

options.label: C
options.text: Translocation of tRNA–nascent protein complex from A to P sites

questions.correct_answer: C. Translocation of tRNA–nascent protein complex from A to P sites

questions.text: A potent inhibitor of protein synthesis that acts as an analogue of aminoacyl-tRNA is
Which one of the following structures may be classified as a hydrophobic amino acid at pH 7.0?
Which of the following amino acids is ionizable in proteins?
DNA fingerprinting is used for paternity testing and forensic identification of suspects. Which of the following is the most accurate description of DNA fingerprinting?

options.label: A
options.text: DNA can be isolated from blood, skin, or sperm and analyzed for variable patterns of restriction fragments arising from tandemly repeated sequences (microsatellites)

options.label: B
options.text: DNA is copied from blood, skin, or sperm RNA using reverse transcriptase and analyzed for the pattern of complementary DNAs

options.label: C
options.text: DNA is isolated from blood, skin, or sperm and its fragment size distribution is analyzed by gel electrophoresis

options.label: D
options.text: DNA is isolated from blood, skin, or sperm and hybridized with probes from the HLA locus to visualize HLA gene patterns

questions.correct_answer: D. DNA is isolated from blood, skin, or sperm and hybridized with probes from the HLA locus to visualize HLA gene patterns

questions.text: The removal of introns and subsequent self-splicing of adjacent exons occurs in some portions of primary ribosomal RNA transcripts. The splicing of introns in messenger RNA precursors is

options.label: A
options.text: RNA-catalyzed in the absence of protein

questions.text: GLUT-2 is seen in :
Non ketotic hypoglycemis are all except :
All are ‘Omega-3 fatty acids except :
Thiamine deficiency shows :

Glucosamine used in which of the following condition?

Collagen, the most abundant protein in the human body, is present in varying amounts in many tissues. If one wished to compare the collagen content of several tissues, one could measure their content of

A 6-month-old infant is seen with a fractured rib and subdural hematoma.The child's hair is thin, colorless, and tangled. His serum copper level is 5.5 nM (normal for age, 11-12 nM). Developmental delay is prominent.A deficiency of which enzyme activity most closely relates to these symptoms?
Respiratory tract infections caused by Pseudomonas aeruginosa are associated with the secretion of exotoxin A by this organism. What effect will this toxin most likely have on eukaryotic cells?

Assertion (A) : Glucogon is required for glycogenesis ? Reasoning (R) : The enzyme glycogen phosphorylase which is the rate limiting enzyme for glycogenesis is active in phosphorylated form for which glucagon is needed.

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both are right but R is not the correct explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A as well as R both are right and R is a correct explanation of A

options.label: C
options.text: A is wrong but R is a right statement.

options.label: D
options.text: A and R both are wrong.

questions.correct_answer: D. A and R both are wrong.

questions.text: If choline moiety is replaced by ethanolamine, the net product is ?
The amino acid sequence of Lipoprotein A is homologous to which of the following proteins?
The key regulatory enzyme of the pentose phosphate pathway is positively regulated by
A 32 years old man is starving for the last 2 days. Which of the following enzymes will be activated in his body?
If in a person total cholesterol =300 mg/dl , HDL, = 25 mg/dl and triglycerides = 150 mg/dl , what will be the LDL levels
Which of the following events occurs during formation of phosphoenolpyruvate from pyruvate during gluconeogenesis?
The entry point into the citric acid cycle for isoleucine, valine, and the product of odd-chain fatty acids is
Oxidative degradation of acetyl coenzyme A (CoA) in the citric acid cycle gives a net yield of which of the following chemicals?
Which of the following statements about glycogen metabolism is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Cyclic AMP–activated protein kinase stimulates glycogen synthase

options.label: B
options.text: Phosphorylase kinase is activated by phosphorylation

options.label: C
options.text: Phosphorylase b is inactivated by phosphorylation

options.label: D
options.text: Glycogen synthesis is stimulated by glucagon

questions.correct_answer: B. Phosphorylase kinase is activated by phosphorylation

questions.text: A 75-year-old woman with osteoporosis complains of back pain. A computed tomo graphic scan of her back confirms a compression fracture of the L3 vertebra. The attending physician begins treating the patient with morphine for pain control. Morphine is an analgesic that works similarly to which of the following endogenously produced substances?

A 13-year-old boy has developed polydipsia, polyuria, polyphagia, and weight loss over the past few weeks. He was brought to the emergency room by his parents because he woke up this morning very lethargic. His blood glucose was found to be 600 mg/dL, and he was immediately placed on an insulin drip. Insulin works primarily by which one of the following mechanisms?
questions.correct_answer: D. Causing Phosphorylation of tyrosine residues.

questions.text: A 43-year-old man presents to the neurologist with headache and double vision. He also complains of a milky discharge from his breast. An MRI of his head confirms the diagnosis of a prolactinoma. Which of the following substances could inhibit the release of prolactin from the pituitary?
McArdle’s disease causes muscle cramps and muscle fatigue with increased muscle glycogen. Which of the following enzymes is deficient?
If all potential sources of ATP production are taken into account, the net number of ATP molecules formed per molecule of glucose in aerobic glycolysis is
Inhibition of the synthesis of ATP during oxidative phosphorylation by oligomycin is thought to be due to

options.label: A
options.text: Blocking of the proton gradient between NADH-Q reductase and QH2

options.label: B
options.text: Blocking of the proton gradient between cytochrome c1 and cytochrome c

options.label: C
options.text: Dissociating of cytochrome c from mitochondrial membranes

questions.correct_answer: D. Inhibiting of mitochondrial ATPase (ATP synthase)

questions.text: Which enzyme is responsible for production of allosteric regulator of another enzyme in the list given below?
Which of the descriptions below best fits inositol 1,4,5-triphosphate?

options.label: A
options.text: A depositor of calcium in endoplasmic reticulum

options.label: B
options.text: An inhibitor of protein kinase C

options.label: C
options.text: A second messenger produced by the action of phospholipase C

questions.correct_answer: C. A second messenger produced by the action of phospholipase C

questions.text: Cholera toxin causes massive and often fatal diarrhea by

options.label: C
options.text: Locking Gs protein into an inactive form

options.label: D
options.text: Rapidly hydrolyzing G protein GTP to GDP

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman complains of feeling warm all of the time. Her eyes appear as though they are ‘‘bulging out of their sockets’’ (proptosis). She sees a family physician to evaluate her condition. Laboratory tests demonstrate a decreased level of TSH. Which of the following would you expect in this patient?

A 23-year-old man presents with a painless swelling of his testicles. An ultrasound is suspicious for a neoplasm, and a biopsy confirms the presence of cancer. He is referred to an oncologist, who begins treatment with the topoisomerase inhibitor etoposide. The normal function of this enzyme is to do which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Repair nuclear DNA in the event of DNA damage.

options.label: B
options.text: Unwind the DNA helix during replication.

options.label: C
options.text: Break and rejoin the DNA helix during replication.

options.label: D
options.text: Prevent the single strands of DNA from reannealing during replication.

questions.correct_answer: C. Break and rejoin the DNA helix during replication.

questions.text: A 37-year-old immigrant from Thailand develops fevers, night sweats, weight loss, and a blood-tinged cough. He present to the emergency room, where an infectious disease doctor is consulted and immediately prescribes a multidrug regimen that includes rifampin. Rifampin inhibits which one of the following types of enzymes?

A 4-year-old child is referred to a pediatric neurologist after presenting with myoclonic seizures and lactic acidosis. The neurologist orders a muscle biopsy, and the pathology returns with the appearance of ‘‘ragged red fibers.’’ The parents are informed that the child has MERFF syndrome, a mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) disorder. Which of the following statements best explains mtDNA?

options.label: A
options.text: It is inherited equally from both parents.

options.label: B
options.text: It is replicated with increased fidelity with respect to nuclear DNA.

options.label: C
options.text: It shares the same genetic code as nuclear DNA.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a double-stranded circular DNA.

questions.correct_answer: D. It is a double-stranded circular DNA.

questions.text: A 34-year-old man of Italian descent is seen for a yearly physical examination. He has no complaints and is in good health. However, he does relay a family history of anemia, and a complete blood count demonstrates a mild anemia; the physician suspects thalassemia minor in the patient. Thalassemia is often due to an alteration in RNA splicing, which is an essential part of mRNA processing in eukaryotes. Which of the following is a correct statement concerning mRNA processing?

options.label: A
options.text: Poly(A) RNA is the initial transcript produced, which is subsequently spliced to mRNA.

options.label: B
options.text: The coding region of the gene is found within introns.

options.label: C
options.text: The coding regions of the gene are found within exons.

options.label: D
options.text: The 5’ end of the intron contains the nucleotides AG followed by an invariant GU.

questions.correct_answer: C. The coding regions of the gene are found within exons.

questions.text: Which one of the following tissues can metabolize glucose, fatty acids, and ketone bodies for ATP production?

There is but a single enzyme-catalyzed reaction in the human body known to generate carbon monoxide (CO) as one of its products.Which of the following enzymes represents the one that catalyzes this CO-producing reaction?
Which among the following reactions requires pyridoxal phosphate as a coenzyme?
The rate-limiting step in glycolysis occurs at the step catalyzed by which of the following enzymes?
The statin class of drugs that are currently used to control hypercholesterolemia function to lower circulating levels of cholesterol by which of the following mechanisms?

options.label: A
options.text: Increasing the elimination of bile acids, leading to increased diversion of cholesterol into bile acid production

options.label: B
options.text: Increasing the synthesis of apolipoprotein B-100 (apo B100), resulting in increased elimination of cholesterol through the action of low-density lipoprotein (LDL) uptake by the liver

options.label: C
options.text: Inhibiting the interaction of LDLs with the hepatic LDL receptor

options.label: D
options.text: Inhibiting the rate-limiting step in cholesterol biosynthesis

questions.correct_answer: D. Inhibiting the rate-limiting step in cholesterol biosynthesis

questions.text: Which of the following represents the enzyme deficiency that leads to “essential fructosuria”?
Hepatocytes deliver ketone bodies to the circulation because they lack which of the following enzymes?
Which of the following statements reflects the process by which the telomeric ends of chromosomes are replicated?

options.label: A
options.text: A unique RNA molecule serves as the primer for synthesis.

options.label: B
options.text: A unique RNA molecule serves as the template for synthesis.

options.label: C
options.text: Short template-independent block of DNA are ligated to the ends using a 5’-5’ bond.

options.label: D
options.text: Telomeres are replicated in a templeindependent process.

questions.correct_answer: B. A unique RNA molecule serves as the template for synthesis.

questions.text: Product produced by action of aldolase on substrate formed from fructose are ?
You are working in a PHC and have to send a sample for blood glucose estimation, which of the following anticoagulant will you use ?

Assertion (A) : Muscle glycogenolysis is not regulated by blood glucose level, stored glycogen of the muscle is utilized only within the muscle after glycogenolysis ? Reasoning (R) : Lack of glucose transport in the muscle sarcolemma is responsible for such phenomenon

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both are right but R is not the correct explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A as well as R both are right and R is a correct explanation of A

options.label: C
options.text: A is right but R is not the correct explanation of A

options.label: D
options.text: A and R both are wrong

questions.correct_answer: C. A is right but R is not the correct explanation of A

questions.text: The deficiency of an excision endonuclease may produce an exquisite sensitivity to ultraviolet radiation in Xeroderma pigmentosum. Which of the following functions would be absent in a patient deficient in this endonuclease?

options.label: C
options.text: Repair of mismatched bases during DNA replication

options.label: D
options.text: Repair of mismatched bases during transcription

questions.text: The anti-Pseudomonas action of norfloxacin is related to its ability to inhibit chromosome duplication in rapidly dividing cells. Which of the following enzymes participates in bacterial DNA replication and is directly inhibited by this antibiotic?
Sorghum causes pellagra due to the presence of:
The major metabolic product produced under normal circumstances by erythrocytes and by muscle cells during intense exercise is recycled through the liver in the Cori cycle. The metabolite is

In lung diseases such as emphysema or chronic bronchitis, there is chronic hypoxia that is particularly obvious in vascular tissues such as the lips or nail beds (cyanosis). Poorly perfused areas exposed to chronic hypoxia have decreased metabolic energy for tissue maintenance and repair. An important reason for this is

options.label: A
options.text: Increased hexokinase activity owing to increased oxidative phosphorylation

options.label: B
options.text: Increased ethanol formation from pyruvate on changing from anaerobic to aerobic metabolism

options.label: C
options.text: Increased glucose utilization via the pentose phosphate pathway on changing from anaerobic to aerobic metabolism

options.label: D
options.text: Decreased ATP generation and increased glucose utilization on changing from aerobic to anaerobic metabolism

questions.correct_answer: D. Decreased ATP generation and increased glucose utilization on changing from aerobic to anaerobic metabolism

questions.text: Following a meal of skim milk and yogurt, an adult female patient experiences abdominal distention, nausea, cramping, and pain followed by a watery diarrhea. This set of symptoms is observed each time the meal is consumed. A likely diagnosis is
Enzyme deficient in phenyl ketonuria is :
Enzyme deficient in X-linked sideroblastic anaemia

A second-year medical student is working in a laboratory studying gene regulation in a mouse model of hepatocellular carcinoma. He isolates nucleic acids from the cells after exposure to a known carcinogen and has the sequences analyzed. He is surprised to find that some of the nucleotides are pseudouridine and ribothymidine. Which type of nucleic acid has the student likely isolated?

A 14-year-old African American girl with sickle cell anemia presents with extreme pain in her chest and legs. A peripheral smear shows sickling of her red blood cells, and her reticulocyte count is 6.7%. She is diagnosed with an acute pain crisis secondary to microvascular occlusion from sickled erythrocytes. Sickle cell anemia is caused by a mutation that results in one amino acid being replaced by another, which results from which of the following?

A 53-year-old man sees his family physician with concerns that his skin is ‘‘bronzing.’’ He is found to have diabetes as well as an elevated ferritin level (a sign of iron overload). The physician suspects hemochromatosis and confirms the diagnosis with genetic testing. It is found that the patient’s DNA carries a mutation in which tyrosine is substituted for cysteine at position 282 (C282Y) within the HFE gene. What word below best describes this type of mutation?
If the ?G of a reaction is zero:

options.label: A
options.text: The reaction goes virtually to completion and is essentially irreversible.

options.label: D
options.text: The system is at equilibrium and no net change occurs.

questions.correct_answer: D. The system is at equilibrium and no net change occurs.

questions.text: Which among the following amino acids absorbs UV light?

A newborn becomes progressively lethargic after feeding and increases his respiratory rate. He becomes virtually comatose, responding only to painful stimuli, and exhibits mild respiratory alkalosis. Suspicion of a urea cycle disorder is aroused and evaluation of serum amino acid levels is initiated. In the presence of hyperammonemia, production of which of the following amino acids is always increased?
Which of the following amino acids is a precursor to cysteine?
Which clinical laboratory observation below is suggestive of Hartnup disease (neutral amino acid transport deficiency)?

options.label: C
options.text: Extremely high levels of citrulline in urine

options.label: D
options.text: High fecal levels of tryptophan and indole derivatives

questions.correct_answer: D. High fecal levels of tryptophan and indole derivatives

questions.text: Two vitamins whose derivatives are involved in transformation of serine to glycine are

A 54-year-old man presents to his family physician with a 3- to 4-week history of a nonproductive cough and a low-grade fever. The physician suspects an atypical pneumonia from Mycoplasma pneumoniae, and decides to treat the patient empirically with erythromycin. Which of the following best describes the mechanism of action of erythromycin?

options.label: A
options.text: Binds to the 5’ cap of mRNA and prevents translation.

options.label: B
options.text: Binds to the 30S ribosomal subunit and blocks peptidyl transferase activity.

options.label: C
options.text: Binds to and inhibits initiation factor IF-1 from binding to the initiation complex.

options.label: D
options.text: Binds to the 50S ribosomal subunit and blocks translocation during translation.

questions.correct_answer: D. Binds to the 50S ribosomal subunit and blocks translocation during translation.

questions.text: A 27-year-old man is seen by his physician for a week-long cough, sore throat, and difficulty swallowing. He is diagnosed with diphtheria, which has reactivated because of waning immunity. One way in which diphtheria toxin leads to cell death is through the inhibition of eEF-2. Which statement best explains the function of eEF-2?

options.label: A
options.text: It is required for the translocation of peptidyl-tRNA during translation.

options.label: B
options.text: It is required for the initiation of protein synthesis.

options.label: C
options.text: It is the agent that binds to, and is inactivated by, chloramphenicol.

options.label: D
options.text: It functions as a peptidyl transferase.

questions.correct_answer: A. It is required for the translocation of peptidyl-tRNA during translation.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding prokaryotic and eukaryotic genomes?

options.label: A
options.text: They both organize and compact their DNA with histones.

options.label: B
options.text: They both have short repetitive DNA sequences throughout their genome.

options.label: C
options.text: They both organize their genes into operons.

options.label: D
options.text: They both use the same genetic code to convert codons to amino acids.

questions.correct_answer: D. They both use the same genetic code to convert codons to amino acids.

questions.text: A 23-year-old man is seen in the gastroenterologist’s office for a referral concerning a family history of a1-antitrypsin deficiency. The physician arranges for the interventional radiologist to perform a liver biopsy, which will allow a determination of the extent of accumulation of non secreted protein in the hepatocyte. Which of the following statements is true concerning proteins like a1-antitrypsin that are normally secreted from the cell?

options.label: A
options.text: They are synthesized on ribosomes attached to the smooth endoplasmic reticulum.

options.label: B
options.text: The signal sequence is found on the C terminus of the protein.

options.label: C
options.text: Glycosylation takes place only in the endoplasmic reticulum.

options.label: D
options.text: Proteins travel from the endoplasmic reticulum to the Golgi apparatus and are ultimately secreted by exocytosis.

questions.correct_answer: D. Proteins travel from the endoplasmic reticulum to the Golgi apparatus and are ultimately secreted by exocytosis.

questions.text: Which one of the following best describes the action of phospholipase C?

options.label: A
options.text: It releases the fatty acyl chain from the sn-2 position of a phospholipid.

options.label: B
options.text: It cleaves the phospholipid into its phosphate containing head group and a diacylglycerol

options.label: C
options.text: It releases the head group of a phospholipid, leaving phosphatidic acid.

options.label: D
options.text: It releases the fatty acyl chain from the sn-1 position of a phospholipid

questions.correct_answer: B. It cleaves the phospholipid into its phosphate containing head group and a diacylglycerol

questions.text: Gene transcription rates and mRNA levels were determined for an enzyme that is induced by glucocorticoids. Compared with untreated levels, glucocorticoid treatment caused a 10-fold increase in the gene transcription rate and a 20-fold increase in both mRNA levels and enzyme activity. These data indicate that a primary effect of glucocorticoid in this assay is to decrease which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: The activity of RNA polymerase II.

options.label: C
options.text: The ability of nucleases to act on mRNA.

options.label: D
options.text: The rate of binding of ribosomes to mRNA.

questions.correct_answer: C. The ability of nucleases to act on mRNA.
